013package org.apache.juneau.svl.vars;
014
015import java.util.regex.*;
016
017import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
018import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
019
020/**
021 * A transformational variable that returns matched regex groups by given index.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * The format for this var:
025 * <ul>
026 *    <li><js>"$PE{arg,pattern,groupIndex}"</js>
027 * </ul>
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * The pattern can be any string optionally containing <js>'*'</js> or <js>'?'</js> representing any or one character
031 * respectively.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
034 * <p class='bjava'>
035 *    <jc>// Create a variable resolver that resolves system properties and $SW vars.</jc>
036 *    VarResolver <jv>varResolver</jv> = VarResolver.<jsm>create</jsm>().vars(PatternExtractVar.<jk>class</jk>, SystemPropertiesVar.<jk>class</jk>).build();
037 *
038 *    <jc>// Use it!</jc>
039 *    System.<jsf>out</jsf>.println(<jv>varResolver</jv>.resolve(<js>"Update = $PE{$P{java.version},_([0-9]+),1}!"</js>));
040 * </p>
041 *
042 * <p>
043 * Since this is a {@link MultipartVar}, any variables contained in the result will be recursively resolved.
044 * <br>Likewise, if the arguments contain any variables, those will be resolved before they are passed to this var.
045 *
046 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
047 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#jm.SimpleVariableLanguage">Simple Variable Language</a>
048 * </ul>
049 */
050public class PatternExtractVar extends MultipartVar {
051
052   /** The name of this variable. */
053   public static final String NAME = "PE";
054
055   /**
056    * Constructor.
057    */
058   public PatternExtractVar() {
059      super(NAME);
060   }
061
062   @Override /* MultipartVar */
063   public String resolve(VarResolverSession session, String[] args) {
064      Utils.assertArg(args.length == 3, "Invalid number of arguments passed to $PE var.  Must have 3 arguments.");
065
066      String stringArg = args[0];
067      String pattern = args[1];
068      String result = "";
069      int groupId = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
070
071      Pattern p = Pattern.compile(pattern.replace("*", ".*").replace("?", "."));
072      Matcher m = p.matcher(stringArg);
073
074      if (m.find() && groupId <= m.groupCount() && groupId >= 0) {
075         result = m.group(groupId);
076      }
077
078      return result;
079   }
080}
